item.title: CI pipeline are getting failed with latest release
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Platform Outage Summary: The latest release caused a critical issue, resulting in a major platform outage. The team has reverted to the old release to resolve the issue.

Feb 27, 02:18 PST
Resolved - Issue was with latest release, reverted to old release.

Feb 27, 02:17 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Hosted CI Builds on MacOS are failing to initialize in all environments
item.content:encoded:
```html [Medium] - Investigating

Summary: The company is currently investigating the issue. ```

Feb 21, 19:03 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue

item.title: Quarterly DR Testing maintenance notice
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Application Failover Testing Summary: Harness will be conducting application failover testing on March 2nd, impacting all Prod 1, prod 2, and Prod 3 services. Service disruption is expected as multiple failure scenarios are tested.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 2, 07:00 - 10:59 PST

Feb 2, 10:26 PST
Scheduled - To validate Harness reliability, we'll test our application failover on Saturday, March 2nd, from 7:00 a.m. to 10:59 a.m. Pacific time (15:00-18:59 UTC).
During testing time, Harness SaaS services may intermittently slow down and stop responding, causing disruption of service as we check multiple failure scenarios and our response to each.
This will impact all clusters Prod 1, prod 2, and Prod 3 services.

item.title: Hosted CI Builds on MacOS are failing to initialize in all environments
item.content:encoded:
Feb 11, 19:35 PST
Resolved - Systems are back to operational. Postmortem will contain details and identified action items.

Feb 11, 19:20 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Feature Flag metrics service degraded
item.content:encoded:
Feb 5, 10:45 PST
Resolved - The incident has been resolved. We will provide a postmortem once we have gathered all the details.

Feb 5, 10:35 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating unusually high latency on the Feature Flag metrics service, due to a high volume of traffic

item.title: The UI is not loading in Prod-3 after the deployment.
item.content:encoded:
Jan 29, 16:56 PST
Resolved - The incident has been resolved. We will provide a postmortem once we have gathered all the details.

Jan 29, 16:47 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 29, 16:44 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CCM: Autostopping rules not working
item.content:encoded:
Jan 28, 23:23 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 28, 23:21 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 28, 22:36 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 28, 22:26 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Customer Overview Page is slow to load and failing in certain instances
item.content:encoded:
Jan 18, 10:03 PST
Resolved - The incident has been resolved.

Jan 18, 09:58 PST
Monitoring - The issue has been resolved and the overview page is back to normal. We are actively monitoring the systems.

Jan 18, 09:53 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified. Team is working to mitigate the issue and provide a solution as soon as possible.

Jan 18, 09:20 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 18, 09:14 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating an issue where customer dashboards are slow to load or failing to load in some specific environment.
This does not impact the pipelines running or deployments.

item.title: Users from Prod2 cluster faced internal error after logging in
item.content:encoded:
Jan 7, 23:28 PST
Resolved - The issue was resolved once we did the rollback of the most recent deployment.

Jan 7, 23:23 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CCM Asset Governance slow performance
item.content:encoded:
Jan 4, 10:49 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 4, 10:40 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jan 4, 10:30 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jan 4, 10:20 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Users from Prod 1 and Prod 2 clusters were unable to access Harness Platform
item.content:encoded:
Dec 22, 04:36 PST
Resolved - There was a downtime observed with the Harness platform for the Prod1 and Prod 2 clusters. The login page was not accessible and 502 errors were returned.
We are investigating the root cause of the issue and will post RCA here. All functionalities are restored now.

item.title: Pipeline initialization failures observed while resolving environment variable expressions.
item.content:encoded:
Dec 21, 14:37 PST
Resolved - The incident has been resolved. We plan to publish the Postmortem early next week. Our pipeline execution failure rate was less than 1% during this incident. As a result, no downtime was taken.

Dec 21, 14:11 PST
Monitoring - We have reverted the services back to the previous version and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 21, 14:06 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Dec 21, 14:05 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Pipelines that reference the Docker in Docker (DIND) image are currently failing. We are currently investigating the issue.
item.content:encoded:
Dec 18, 11:43 PST
Resolved - The problem was primarily with the image being used, and we have notified customers to use a stable version of DIND to prevent this issue https://github.com/docker-library/docker/commit/4c2674df4f40c965cdb8ccc77b8ce9dbc247a6c9

Dec 18, 10:52 PST
Update - We continue to look into the situation. At the moment, two customers are affected, and our team is working on debugging the issue.

Dec 18, 10:22 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CD and CI pipelines that reference secrets are experiencing failures.
item.content:encoded:
Dec 11, 09:04 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 11, 09:01 PST
Monitoring - The issue has been resolved. We are continuing to monitor the incident.

Dec 11, 08:42 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

item.title: Pipelines that reference the secrets are experiencing failures in the Prod-2 cluster. Impact - Every pipeline step that refers to a secret will cause the pipeline execution to fail
item.content:encoded:
Dec 7, 19:18 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved, the impacted components were Prod 2 - Continuous Delivery - Next Generation (CDNG) and Continuous Integration Enterprise(CIE) - Self Hosted Runners.

Dec 7, 19:03 PST
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Dec 7, 19:01 PST
Monitoring - The incident is now resolved. Detailed RCA to follow.

Dec 7, 18:13 PST
Update - We have identified the root cause and we are in the process of recovering.

Dec 7, 18:08 PST
Update - The secret decryption task is failing and we are looking into a recovery

Dec 7, 17:44 PST
Update - We are rolling back the services to the previously deployed version. We will keep you updated on the progress.

Dec 7, 16:23 PST
Update - We are currently working on debugging the issue. We have identified that there may be a problem with the gRPC calls between services. We will keep you updated on the progress.

Dec 7, 15:44 PST
Update - We are currently in the process of identifying the incident. As soon as it is identified, we will provide an update.

Dec 7, 14:36 PST
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Dec 7, 14:35 PST
Identified - We continue to look into the issue and are considering rolling back the latest deployment

Dec 7, 14:34 PST
Investigating - Pipelines that reference the secrets are experiencing failures in the Prod-2 cluster starting around 9:13 PM UTC. Harness team started looking into the issue and a high severity incident was declared at 10:34 PM UTC.

item.title: Intermittent failures for hosted CI build
item.content:encoded:
Dec 7, 14:41 PST
Resolved - We have added an additional fallback regions to Prod 1 and 3 and now issue is resolved.

Dec 7, 14:19 PST
Update - The issue is resolved for prod 2, we have added an additional fallback region.
We are actively working on rolling this out to prod 1 and prod 3.

Dec 7, 14:17 PST
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Dec 7, 13:27 PST
Identified - We are currently experiencing availability issues with our fallback region for cloud builds. This issue occurs intermittently when we switch from fallback from primary due to any errors. The team is actively working on adding an additional fallback option to another region in order to address this issue.

Dec 7, 12:08 PST
Investigating - We are experiencing intermittent failures on cloud builds due to a resource issue. We are currently investigating.

item.title: Harness Overview page showing 400 Error
item.content:encoded:
Nov 27, 02:08 PST
Resolved - The issue is resolved after rollback.

Nov 27, 02:03 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue and rolled back latest deployment to quickly resolve this issue.

Nov 27, 02:02 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CCM Connector Validation failing for some accounts
item.content:encoded:
Nov 13, 08:19 PST
Resolved - For the customer that raised the issue, data has been replayed and everything is working fine for all three cloud providers.

Nov 13, 07:46 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 13, 07:34 PST
Identified - Customers in Prod-1 and Prod-1 are affected
We have identified the issue and fix is also done. We are going to replay the cloud functions since Nov 9 for these accounts.

Nov 13, 07:03 PST
Update - The issue is happening for all the currency preferences enabled customers

Nov 13, 06:09 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Quarterly DR Testing maintenance notice
item.content:encoded:
Nov 11, 11:01 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Nov 11, 07:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 3, 12:11 PDT
Scheduled - To validate Harness reliability, we'll test our application failover on Saturday, Nov 11th, from 7:00 a.m. to 10:59 a.m. Pacific time (15:00-18:59 UTC).
During testing time, Harness SaaS services may intermittently slow down and stop responding, causing disruption of service as we check multiple failure scenarios and our response to each.
This will impact all clusters Prod 1, prod 2, and Prod 3 services.

item.title: Dependency workload not coming up for Autostopping
item.content:encoded:
Nov 7, 07:26 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 7, 07:04 PST
Update - Customer was able to manually start the resources, so there was no downtime. Team is looking into what went wrong with the schedule.

Nov 7, 06:34 PST
Update - We have reviewed our operational metrics and can confirm that this issue is isolated to some rules for a single customer.
Warm up operations across all other customers are functioning as expected and is not impacted.

Nov 7, 05:57 PST
Monitoring - Customer has used manual start button to start the resources and the services are up and running. No other customer was impacted.

Nov 7, 05:38 PST
Identified - The issue has been identified and they have used manual start button to start the resources and the services are up and running

Nov 7, 05:21 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Nov 7, 05:11 PST
Investigating - Trying to reach out to Autostopping team to look into this

item.title: Pipelines with a specific scenario using "step groups" are impacted
item.content:encoded:
Nov 3, 12:33 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 3, 12:28 PDT
Monitoring - A rollback has been performed and we are currently monitoring it.

Nov 3, 11:52 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Pipelines with Hosted Mac Infrastructure are impacted
item.content:encoded:
Nov 2, 04:20 PDT
Resolved - The incident has been resolved and the pool capacity is freed up. We will provide additional details including RCA in postmortem.
We regret the impact this disruption might have caused to few customers.

Nov 2, 04:00 PDT
Identified - Pipelines with infrastructure as Cloud->MacOS are impacted due to pool running at full capacity.

Nov 2, 02:56 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Pipeline Failure - TI Service Call Graph Upload Issue
item.content:encoded:
Nov 1, 13:34 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 1, 11:43 PDT
Update - The incident has been resolved. Will post details in the post mortem.

Nov 1, 07:37 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: CI pipelines where clone codebase was disabled started to fail with error “no codebase configured“
item.content:encoded:
Oct 24, 15:50 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Oct 24, 15:30 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Users of Harness First Gen CD are facing performance degradation with Automated Artifact collection in Prod1 cluster
item.content:encoded:
Oct 18, 12:17 PDT
Resolved - The issue has been resolved and we will continue to monitor the situation.

Oct 18, 10:25 PDT
Monitoring - We have successfully mitigated this issue and are actively monitoring the situation. We discovered a significant number of database records not getting processed and we've manually cleared these records to mitigate the issue

Oct 18, 08:55 PDT
Identified - Issue identified and we are currently working on mitigation

Oct 18, 06:52 PDT
Update - We have reproduced the issue with Harness Internal account and we are continuously investigating the Artifact Collection task lifecycle to understand the issue further. As a Workaround for this issue customers can manually pull the artifacts.

Oct 18, 04:50 PDT
Investigating - Some of harness customers are still facing the issue. We are continuously investigating the issue.

Oct 18, 03:34 PDT
Monitoring - The service has been restored, We have enabled Additional Monitoring as part of the investigation. We are actively monitoring this issue.

Oct 18, 02:01 PDT
Investigating - We have noticed degraded performance with Automatic artifact collection. Team is currently Investigating the issue.

item.title: Artifact collection is working with degraded performance
item.content:encoded:
Oct 17, 18:23 PDT
Resolved - We will keep a close watch on the situation.

Oct 17, 17:08 PDT
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Oct 17, 17:03 PDT
Monitoring - We will continue to monitor the situation

Oct 17, 16:46 PDT
Update - While the service has been resorted, we're currently in the process of identifying its root cause. We initially observed delays in the Artifact collection, and we're diligently working to pinpoint the exact reason behind this delay.

Oct 17, 15:47 PDT
Investigating - Team has noticed degraded performance with artifact collection. Investigation is in progress.

item.title: Hosted Mac builds on Prod 2 are failing
item.content:encoded:
Oct 16, 09:50 PDT
Resolved - The issue was resolved after dlite pod bounce and the hosted mac pipelines are running smoothly.

Oct 16, 09:48 PDT
Investigating - Hosted Mac builds on Pod2 have failed between 11:00 PM PT and 12:00AM PT on October 15, 2023.
This is due to a recent code change that has since been reverted.

We will provide a Post Mortem with additional details.
